Name: Pattern Recognition - PE
Text: Recognizing patterns in activity sequences across different cases, such as the occurrence of loops (e.g., AS and IQC looping based on quality checks, and TST and RT looping for re-testing).

Name: Deductive Reasoning - PE
Text: Using the event log data and activity dependencies to deduce that OR must precede MS, which must precede QS, forming a strict sequential chain for the first three activities in the workflow.

Name: Abductive Reasoning - IND
Text: Hypothesizing that the loop structure for AS and IQC involves * (AS, IQC) based on case data where IQC determines whether to loop back to AS.

Name: Deductive Reasoning - PE
Text: Deriving that the TST and RT activities follow a loop structure based on cases where RT occurs only as a trigger to return to TST.

Name: Pattern Recognition - PE
Text: Identifying an XOR split for LB (Labeling) and its optional nature, as observed in cases where LB is skipped.

Name: Inductive Reasoning - PE
Text: Generalizing from all cases that the full workflow must follow a strict sequence of OR → MS → QS → AS/IQC loop → TST/RT loop → PK → LB choice → DP → D.

Name: Validation - PE
Text: Verifying that all event cases align with the proposed POWL structure, with no violations of defined dependency relationships.
